Table 1: Iteration complexities of NPG and FedNPG (ours) methods to reach ε𝜀\varepsilon-accuracy of the vanilla and entropy-regularized problems, where we assume exact gradient evaluation, and only keep the dominant terms w.r.t. ε𝜀\varepsilon. The policy estimates in the t𝑡t-iteration are π(t)superscript𝜋𝑡\pi^{(t)} and π¯(t)superscript¯𝜋𝑡\bar{\pi}^{(t)} for NPG and FedNPG, respectively, where T𝑇T is the number of iterations. Here, N𝑁N is the number of agents, τ≤1𝜏1\tau\leq 1 is the regularization parameter, σ∈[0,1]𝜎01\sigma\in[0,1] is the spectral radius of the network, γ∈[0,1)𝛾01\gamma\in[0,1) is the discount factor, |𝒜|𝒜|{\mathcal{A}}| is the size of the action space, and η>0𝜂0\eta>0 is the learning rate.
For vanilla FedNPG, the learning rate is set as η=η1=𝒪​((1−γ)9​(1−σ)2​log⁡|𝒜|T​N​σ)1/3𝜂subscript𝜂1𝒪superscriptsuperscript1𝛾9superscript1𝜎2𝒜𝑇𝑁𝜎13\eta=\eta_{1}=\mathcal{O}\left(\frac{(1-\gamma)^{9}(1-\sigma)^{2}\log|{\mathcal{A}}|}{TN\sigma}\right)^{1/3}; for entropy-regularized FedNPG, the learning rate satisfies 0<η<η0=𝒪​((1−γ)7​(1−σ)2​τσ​N)0𝜂subscript𝜂0𝒪superscript1𝛾7superscript1𝜎2𝜏𝜎𝑁0<\eta<\eta_{0}=\mathcal{O}\left(\frac{(1-\gamma)^{7}(1-\sigma)^{2}\tau}{\sigma N}\right). The iteration complexities of FedNPG reduce to their centralized counterparts when σ=0𝜎0\sigma=0.
references:
Assuming access to exact policy evaluation, we establish that the average iterate of vanilla FedNPG converges globally at a rate of 𝒪​(1/T2/3)𝒪1superscript𝑇23\mathcal{O}(1/T^{2/3}) in terms of the sub-optimality gap for the multi-task RL problem, and that the last iterate of entropy-regularized FedNPG converges globally at a linear rate to the regularized optimal policy. Our convergence theory highlights the impacts of all salient problem parameters (see Table 1 for details), such as the size and connectivity of the communication network. In particular, the iteration complexities of FedNPG are again almost independent of the size of the state-action space,
which recover prior results on the centralized NPG methods when the network is fully connected.
